resources.string:
This is an example of a SingleFragmentActivity 
implementation The fragmented approach allows 
you to develop extensible, multi-paned 
applications without having to refactor. It's 
more work up front, but avoids the minefield of 
implementing it later. 

The steps to implement it is as follows: 

1. Create a SingleFragmentActivity that is abstract and has onCreate(Bundle) Method and an abstract createFragment() function. It extends the AppCompatActivity. 

2. Create a host layout named activity_fragment.xml that has a single FrameLayout that will host the fragment. 

3. ParentActivity will implement the SingleFragmentActivity and override the createFragment() 

4. ChildFragment extends the Fragment class and is a fully fledged, final product fragment.
